content: Bank Account DBS Multiplier DBS Salary Savings Asked by AnonymousAsked on 01 Aug 2019Must I credit my salary into the DBS Multiplier account or would any DBS Savings account be alright?Hi, must I credit my salary to my or the DBS Multiplier Account or can I credit it to another DBS Savings account under the same name? Will it still be counted as salary credit?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 01 Aug 2019You can credit to any dbs or posb account in the same name as multiplier account.Mine is credited to my old posb saving account and my multiplier still recognize it.0 comments0
